com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Class AbstractDataRow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.AbstractDataRow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataRow
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicDataRow

    public abstract class AbstractDataRow
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataRow

    The AbstractDataRow class provides a skeletal version of DataRow which implements as many methods as possible, reducing the coding burden on the implementing user. No internal data structures are used in this class, as it only references interface methods. Because of this, some method implementations, such as hasColumn(String), may be less efficient than if row information is accessed using class data structures.

        Description copied from interface: DataRow

      • willCoerceData

        public boolean willCoerceData()
        Description copied from interface: DataRow
        Indicates whether this data table will attempt to coerce data to the correct types when getting. This will be inherited from the row's parent DataTable at the time of creation.
        Specified by:
        willCoerceData in interface DataRow
        Returns:
        true if data will be coerced, false otherwise.
